content: Interesting! Is there more documentation available for this project proposal anywhere?

we had a steering meeting (compiler-team#498; #t-compiler/meetings > [steering meeting] 2022-03-25 compiler-team#488, #498 ) and a doc that drove that meeting: https://hackmd.io/naxjPGp3SL-5EIOjIknCfQ
I'm in the midst of drafting a charter

Anyway, based on the outcome of the steering meeting, I felt like there was sufficient team buy-in to justify creating the zulip stream without waiting for the PR to the teams repo to be merged (https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/729).

On an adjacent topic, I'd be interested to know how this project would interact with other implementations (such as the one I'm working on - lccc).
At first glance at the doc, it looks to just be specific to rustc, though promised to be stable. I would be very interested to know if it is intended (or would realistically end up being) more general than that.

My hope is that stable-mir would be a usable format that other compilers could target, if they wished. There are unresolved questions about that, and I mainly side-stepped those questions in the doc; see e.g. the "maybe: stable-MIR as input format" section of the doc.
Alright. CC: @Ray Redondo who will likely interact with it the most.
